verses.t: The king's{H4428} heart{H3820} is in the hand{H3027} Lordof the {H3068}, as the rivers{H6388} of water{H4325}: he turneth{H5186} it whithersoever he will{H2654}.
Every way{H1870} of a man{H376} is right{H3477} in his own eyes{H5869}: Lordbut the {H3068} pondereth{H8505} the hearts{H3826}.
To do{H6213} justice{H6666} and judgment{H4941} is more acceptable{H977} Lordto the {H3068} than sacrifice{H2077}.
An high{H7312} look{H5869}, and a proud{H7342} heart{H3820}, and the plowing{H5215} of the wicked{H7563}, is sin{H2403}.An…: Heb. Haughtiness of eyesthe plowing: or, the light
The thoughts{H4284} of the diligent{H2742} tend only to plenteousness{H4195}; but of every one that is hasty{H213} only to want{H4270}.
The getting{H6467} of treasures{H214} by a lying{H8267} tongue{H3956} is a vanity{H1892} tossed to and fro of{H5086} them that seek{H1245} death{H4194}.
The robbery{H7701} of the wicked{H7563} shall destroy{H1641} them; because they refuse{H3985} to do{H6213} judgment{H4941}.destroy…: Heb. saw them, or, dwell with them
The way{H1870} of man{H376} is froward{H2019} and strange{H2054}: but as for the pure{H2134}, his work{H6467} is right{H3477}.

It is better{H2896} to dwell{H3427} in a corner{H6438} of the housetop{H1406}, than with a brawling{H4066} woman{H802} in a wide{H2267} house{H1004}.a brawling…: Heb. a woman of contentionsa wide…: Heb. an house of society
The soul{H5315} of the wicked{H7563} desireth{H183} evil{H7451}: his neighbour{H7453} findeth no favour{H2603} in his eyes{H5869}.findeth…: Heb. is not favoured
When the scorner{H3887} is punished{H6064}, the simple{H6612} is made wise{H2449}: and when the wise{H2450} is instructed{H7919}, he receiveth{H3947} knowledge{H1847}.
The righteous{H6662} man wisely considereth{H7919} the house{H1004} of the wicked{H7563}: but God overthroweth{H5557} the wicked{H7563} for their wickedness{H7451}.
Whoso stoppeth{H331} his ears{H241} at the cry{H2201} of the poor{H1800}, he also shall cry{H7121} himself, but shall not be heard{H6030}.
A gift{H4976} in secret{H5643} pacifieth{H3711} anger{H639}: and a reward{H7810} in the bosom{H2436} strong{H5794} wrath{H2534}.
It is joy{H8057} to the just{H6662} to do{H6213} judgment{H4941}: but destruction{H4288} shall be to the workers{H6466} of iniquity{H205}.
The man{H120} that wandereth{H8582} out of the way{H1870} of understanding{H7919} shall remain{H5117} in the congregation{H6951} of the dead{H7496}.
He that loveth{H157} pleasure{H8057} shall be a poor{H4270} man{H376}: he that loveth{H157} wine{H3196} and oil{H8081} shall not be rich{H6238}.pleasure: or, sport
The wicked{H7563} shall be a ransom{H3724} for the righteous{H6662}, and the transgressor{H898} for the upright{H3477}.
It is better{H2896} to dwell{H3427} in the wilderness{H4057}, than with a contentious{H4066} and an angry{H3708} woman{H802}.in…: Heb. in the land of the desert
There is treasure{H214} to be desired{H2530} and oil{H8081} in the dwelling{H5116} of the wise{H2450}; but a foolish{H3684} man{H120} spendeth it up{H1104}.
He that followeth{H7291} after righteousness{H6666} and mercy{H2617} findeth{H4672} life{H2416}, righteousness{H6666}, and honour{H3519}.
A wise{H2450} man scaleth{H5927} the city{H5892} of the mighty{H1368}, and casteth down{H3381} the strength{H5797} of the confidence{H4009} thereof.
Whoso keepeth{H8104} his mouth{H6310} and his tongue{H3956} keepeth{H8104} his soul{H5315} from troubles{H6869}.
Proud{H2086} and haughty{H3093} scorner{H3887} is his name{H8034}, who dealeth{H6213} in proud{H2087} wrath{H5678}.in proud…: Heb. in the wrath of pride
The desire{H8378} of the slothful{H6102} killeth{H4191} him; for his hands{H3027} refuse{H3985} to labour{H6213}.
He coveteth{H183} greedily{H8378} all the day{H3117} long: but the righteous{H6662} giveth{H5414} and spareth{H2820} not.
The sacrifice{H2077} of the wicked{H7563} is abomination{H8441}: how much more, when he bringeth{H935} it with a wicked mind{H2154}?with…: Heb. in wickedness?
A false{H3577} witness{H5707} shall perish{H6}: but the man{H376} that heareth{H8085} speaketh{H1696} constantly{H5331}.A…: Heb. A witness of lies
A wicked{H7563} man{H376} hardeneth{H5810} his face{H6440}: but as for the upright{H3477}, he directeth{H3559} his way{H1870}.directeth: or, considereth
There is no wisdom{H2451} nor understanding{H8394} nor counsel{H6098} Lordagainst the {H3068}.
The horse{H5483} is prepared{H3559} against the day{H3117} of battle{H4421}: but safety{H8668} is Lordof the {H3068}.safety: or, victory
